word: There is room for all in the work of God; for a world demands our labors. We must not put off the doing of our work until labor comes to be regarded as genteel. The life of Christ is a constant rebuke to the one who is willing to sit by with folded hands. Let us now set to work in earnest to do something for Christ.--Ms 105, 1908, pp. 2, 3, 5. ("Words of Counsel to Our Colored People," typed October 19, 1908.)
